snippet: The environmental review could take two to three years and will be coordinated by New Jersey Transit but paid for by Amtrak, officials said.
abstract: New Jersey Transit is set to begin environmental study for Hudson River Tunnels Project, part of Amtrak proposal know as the Gateway project; study could take up to three years and will be paid for by Amtrak, which will also start preliminary engineering work on project.
lead_paragraph: The environmental review could take two to three years and will be coordinated by New Jersey Transit but paid for by Amtrak, officials said.

headline.main: N.J. Transit to Lead Environmental Study for Hudson Rail Tunnel
headline.print_headline: N.J. Transit to Lead Environmental Study for Rail Tunnel Under Hudson
